alert.note: Alert for Accomack; Gloucester; James City; Lancaster; Mathews; Middlesex; Northampton; Northumberland; Richmond; Westmoreland (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 16 at 9:33AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Maryland and Virginia, including the following areas, in southeast Maryland, Dorchester, Inland Worcester, Maryland Beaches, Somerset and Wicomico. In Virginia, Accomack, Eastern King and Queen, Gloucester, Hampton/Poquoson, James City, Lancaster, Mathews, Middlesex, Newport News, Northampton, Northumberland, Richmond, Westmoreland and York. * WHEN...Until 4 PM EDT this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Showers and thunderstorms fell across portions of the area overnight and additional showers and thunderstorms are expected today. A quick 1 to 3 inches of rain is possible in a few spots, which could result in flash flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Accomack; Gloucester; James City; Lancaster; Mathews; Middlesex; Northampton; Northumberland; Richmond; Westmoreland
